timeline.body: Shall we need to add check for non-durable cursor?
timeline.bodyText: Shall we need to add check for non-durable cursor?
timeline.bodyHTML: Shall we need to add check for non-durable cursor?
timeline.author: codelipenghui

replies.bodyText: No need for that, a durable cursor would have been already moved ahead, otherwise we wouldn't be trimming that ledger.
replies.author: merlimat

timeline.body: Why durable cursor has 5 backlogs, non-durable cursor has 6 backlogs? Shouldn't they be the same?
timeline.bodyText: Why durable cursor has 5 backlogs, non-durable cursor has 6 backlogs? Shouldn't they be the same?
timeline.bodyHTML: Why durable cursor has 5 backlogs, non-durable cursor has 6 backlogs? Shouldn't they be the same?
timeline.author: codelipenghui

replies.bodyText:
That's because the other cursor is positioned at the end of the 5th ledger, but not on the 6th. That means that only 4 ledgers are deleted. That cursor would move forward on the next mark-delete.
When advancing the non-durable cursor, we advance to the first available ledger and that might be before the durable cursor mark-delete position, but that's ok.
replies.author: merlimat
